intro: Senecio taraxacoides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disk, and its leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture. Senecio taraxacoides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
